message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about seed dispersal methods. Voles are small rodents that often consume oak pips (seeds) and then deposit them in different locations through their droppings. This helps to spread the seeds and promote plant growth. Option (A) is incorrect because pigs rolling in mud does not have an effect on seed dispersal. Option (B) is unrelated because sweeping floors does not involve seed dispersal. Option (C) is also unrelated because people eating deli ham does not have any impact on seed dispersal.

This question requires knowledge about seed dispersal methods. One common way in which seeds are spread is through animals consuming them and later excreting them in a different location. In this case, voles consuming oak pips (seeds) and then depositing their remains in different areas would be a way in which seeds are frequently dispersed. Option (A) is incorrect because pigs rolling in mud does not involve seed dispersal. Option (B) is unrelated to seed dispersal. Option (C) is also unrelated to seed dispersal as it only mentions people eating deli ham.
